title: picto font with glyph for assistance/security/staffed area
content:
sort of like this.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081119071013im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/crew_car_4728.jpg)

but different.

I’m looking for something that suggests a person in a uniform - but not leaning out a window,

Thanks

 [‹ Does this sound like a logo you've seen?](http://web.archive.org/web/20081119071013/http:/www.typophile.com/node/45923 "Go to previous forum topic") [Require a typeface to go with Apex New ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081119071013/http:/www.typophile.com/node/46042 "Go to next forum topic")
author: russellm

comments.content:
Hi Russell,

have a look at [FF Info Pict 1 (W and X)](http://web.archive.org/web/20081119071013/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/fontfont/ff_info_pict_one/?sample_text=W%20X&sample_size=144) or [Pict 2 (l and m – customs)](http://web.archive.org/web/20081119071013/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/fontfont/ff_info_pict_four/?sample_text=l%20m&sample_size=144).

F

thanks, Florian, but... Yup, I have. And the DOT standard symbols. too cop-like. Workin’ on my own picto now.

-=®=-
